template.name: ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP
template.description:
ZYXEL IES-500x
MIBs used: RFC1213-MIB HOST-RESOURCES-MIB ADSL-LINE-MIB ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB IF-MIB
Known Issues:
Description: Incorrect handling of SNMP bulk requests. Disable the use of bulk requests in the SNMP interface settings. Version: all versions firmware Device: ZYXEL IES-500x
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/422668-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-templates-for-zyxel
Template tooling version used: 0.41

trigger.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

item.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Contact
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person.

item.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Location
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor').

item.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: MAC address
item.description: MIB: IF-MIB The interface's address at the protocol layer immediately `below' the network layer in the protocol stack. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

item.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Hardware model name
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software. It is mandatory that this only contain printable ASCII characters.

trigger.expression: not(last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.model)="IES-5000" or last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.model)="IES-5005")
trigger.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Template does not match hardware
trigger.description: This template is for Zyxel IES-500x, but connected to {ITEM.VALUE}

item.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Host name
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name.

item.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: RFC1213-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

discovery_rule.name: Packet buffer discovery
discovery_rule.description: A table that contains packet buffer usage information.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Packet buffer utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The packet buffer usage in the past 60 seconds.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: High Packet buffer utilization in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES-500x: High Packet buffer utilization in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} (>{#ZYXEL.BUFFERHIGHTHRESH}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The system is running out of free buffer.

graph_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Packet buffer utilization

discovery_rule.name: CPU discovery
discovery_rule.description: A table that contains CPU utilization information. This table is supported by R1.03 and later versions.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The CPU utilization in the past 60 seconds.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} high CPU utilization
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} high CPU utilization (over {#ZYXEL.CPU.THRESH.HIGH}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Fan #{#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB Current speed in Revolutions Per Minute (RPM) on the fan.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.fan[{#SNMPINDEX}])<{#ZYXEL.FANRPM.THRESH.LOW} or last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.fan[{#SNMPINDEX}])>{#ZYXEL.FANRPM.THRESH.HIGH}
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: FAN{#SNMPINDEX} is in critical state

discovery_rule.name: Memory discovery
discovery_rule.description: A table that contains memory usage information.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Memory utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The memory usage in the past 60 seconds.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: High memory utilization in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} pool
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES-500x: High memory utilization in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} pool (>{#ZYXEL.MEMORYHIGHTHRESH}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Administrative status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The desired state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: ATUC attenuation
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Measured difference in the total power transmitted by the peer ATU and the total power received by this ATU. The Info Atuc fields show data acquired from the ATUC (ADSL Termination Unit – Central), in this case ZYXEL IES-500x, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: High the DSL line attenuation in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES-500x: High the DSL line attenuation in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID} (>{$ZYXEL.ADSL.ATN.MAX}dB for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The reductions in amplitude of the downstream and upstream DSL signals.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: ATUC output power
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Measured total output power transmitted by this ATU. The Info Atuc fields show data acquired from the ATUC (ADSL Termination Unit – Central), in this case ZYXEL IES-500x, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: ATUC noise margin
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Noise Margin as seen by this ATU with respect to its received signal in tenth dB. The Info Atuc fields show data acquired from the ATUC (ADSL Termination Unit – Central), in this case ZYXEL IES-500x, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Low the DSL line noise margins in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Low the DSL line noise margins in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID} (<{$ZYXEL.ADSL.SNR.MIN}dB for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Signal-to-noise margin (SNR Margin) which is the difference between the actual SNR and the SNR required to sync at a specific speed

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: ATUR attenuation
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Measured difference in the total power transmitted by the peer ATU and the total power received by this ATU. The Info Atur fields show data acquired from the ATUR (ADSL Termination Unit – Remote), in this case the subscriber's ADSL modem or router, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: High the DSL line attenuation in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES-500x: High the DSL line attenuation in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID} (>{$ZYXEL.ADSL.ATN.MAX}dB for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The reductions in amplitude of the downstream and upstream DSL signals.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: ATUR output power
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Measured total output power transmitted by this ATU. The Info Atur fields show data acquired from the ATUR (ADSL Termination Unit – Remote), in this case the subscriber's ADSL modem or router, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: ATUR noise margin
item_prototype.description: MIB: ADSL-LINE-MIB Noise Margin as seen by this ATU with respect to its received signal in tenth dB. The Info Atur fields show data acquired from the ATUR (ADSL Termination Unit – Remote), in this case the subscriber's ADSL modem or router, during negotiation/provisioning message interchanges.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Low the DSL line noise margins in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Low the DSL line noise margins in Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID} (<{$ZYXEL.ADSL.SNR.MIN}dB for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Signal-to-noise margin (SNR Margin) which is the difference between the actual SNR and the SNR required to sync at a specific speed

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Interface description
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB A textual string containing information about the interface

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Incoming broadcast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Incoming multicast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer. For a MAC layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Incoming traffic
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Incoming unicast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Interface name
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB A textual string containing information about the interface

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.net.adsl.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.net.adsl.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.net.adsl.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Outgoing broadcast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Outgoing multicast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. For a MAC layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Outgoing traffic
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Outgoing unicast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

graph_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Port {#ZYXEL.PORTID}: Packets traffic

override.name: Don't create triggers for matching interface

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Administrative status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The desired state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Interface description
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB A textual string containing information about the interface

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Link speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in bits per second

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Incoming broadcast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Incoming multicast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer. For a MAC layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Incoming traffic
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Incoming unicast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Incoming utilization
item_prototype.description: Interface utilization percentage

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Interface name
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB A textual string containing information about the interface

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.net.if.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.net.if.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.net.if.operstatus[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Outgoing broadcast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Outgoing multicast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. For a MAC layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Outgoing traffic
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Outgoing unicast packages
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Port {#SNMPINDEX}: Outgoing utilization
item_prototype.description: Interface utilization percentage

override.name: Don't create triggers for matching interface

discovery_rule.name: Slot discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table which contains the slot information in a chassis.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Alarm status
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB This variable indicates the alarm status of the module. It is a bit map represented a sum, therefore, it can represent multiple defects simultaneously. The moduleNoDefect should be set if and only if no other flag is set. The various bit positions are: 1 moduleNoDefect 2 moduleOverHeat 3 moduleFanRpmLow 4 moduleVoltageLow 5 moduleThermalSensorFailure 6 modulePullOut 7 powerDC48VAFailure 8 powerDC48VBFailure 9 extAlarmInputTrigger 10 moduleDown 11 mscSwitchOverOK 12 networkTopologyChange 13 macSpoof 14 cpuHigh 15 memoryUsageHigh 16 packetBufferUsageHigh 17 loopguardOccurence

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: DSL modem code version
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The DSL modem code version of the plug-in card.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.cv.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.cv.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.cv.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: DSL modem code has changed
trigger_prototype.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Description
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The descriptions of the plug-in card.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Driver version
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The DSL driver of the plug-in card.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.dv.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.dv.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.dv.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Driver has changed
trigger_prototype.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Firmware version
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The firmware version of the plug-in card.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.fw.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.fw.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.fw.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Firmware has changed
trigger_prototype.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Hardware version
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The hardware version of the plug-in card.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.hw.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.hw.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.hw.ver[{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Hardware version has changed
trigger_prototype.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: MAC address 1
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The MAC Address of the plug-in card.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: MAC address 2
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The MAC Address of the plug-in card.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The serial number of the plug-in card.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.serial[{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.serial[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.slot.serial[{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} has been replaced
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} serial number has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Status
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The module state of the plug-in card.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Type
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB Card type of the plug-in card.

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Uptime
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The time (in seconds) since the plug-in card was last re-initialized.

trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} has been restarted
trigger_prototype.event_name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} has been restarted (uptime < 10m)

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Temperature "{#ZYXEL.TEMP.ID}"
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The current temperature measured at this sensor

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.temp[{#SNMPINDEX}])>{#ZYXEL.TEMP.THRESH.HIGH} or last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.temp[{#SNMPINDEX}])<{#ZYXEL.TEMP.THRESH.LOW}
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Temperature Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} Sensor: {#ZYXEL.TEMP.ID} is in critical state

item_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID}: Nominal "{#ZYXEL.VOLT.NOMINAL}"
item_prototype.description: MIB: ZYXEL-IES5000-MIB The current voltage reading.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.volt[{#SNMPINDEX}])<{#ZYXEL.VOLT.THRESH.LOW} or last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.volt[{#SNMPINDEX}])>{#ZYXEL.VOLT.THRESH.HIGH}
trigger_prototype.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Voltage Slot {#ZYXEL.SLOT.ID} {#ZYXEL.VOLT.NOMINAL} is in critical state

macro.description: The time interval for SNMP agent availability trigger expression.
Type the minimum signal to noise margin (0-31 dB)
Triggers will be created only for interfaces whose description contains the value of this macro
Filter to exclude discovered interfaces by name.
Filter to exclude discovered by link types.
Filter to exclude discovered slots by status.

trigger.expression: (last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.hw.uptime)>0 and last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.hw.uptime)<10m) or (last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.hw.uptime)=0 and last(/ZYXEL IES-500x by SNMP/zyxel.ies500x.net.uptime)<10m)
trigger.name: ZYXEL IES-500x: Host has been restarted
